Topic.Title: Only one youtube video won't play

Posts.EditableText:
I'm trying to make a game with an intro video I animated. I uploaded the video to youtube, it's public, working and visible from other computers and other channels (I checked on my brother's account on his laptop), and it keeps giving me the "The Adobe Flash Player is required for video playback." This, despite the fact it has no qualms about playing literally any other youtube video I've tested. 

Thank you for your time, and any and all help is appreciated.
Posts.HTML:
I'm trying to make a game with an intro video I animated. I uploaded the video to youtube, it's public, working and visible from other computers and other channels (I checked on my brother's account on his laptop), and it keeps giving me the "The Adobe Flash Player is required for video playback." This, despite the fact it has no qualms about playing literally any other youtube video I've tested.

Thank you for your time, and any and all help is appreciated.

Posts.EditableText:
Probably not the cause, but make sure you have the right code embedded.  It's the only thing I could think of.  Whenever I had issues with vids, that was the cause.

https://youtu.be/Po8ur7qWAnA (copied from mobile device)

I believe, in the link above, you would just need to paste all the stuff after youtu.be/ - so, Po8ur7qWAnA

Or, in this one - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ExVtrghW5Y4 (copied from desktop) - everything after the equals sign.

Good luck!
